ollama_generated:
2. Non-Compete Commitment During Negotiations:

During the course of these negotiations and for a period of sixty (60) days thereafter, each Party acknowledges and agrees that it shall not enter into any agreement or arrangement with any third party, which may directly or indirectly compete with the proposed collaboration between the Parties, unless otherwise mutually agreed in writing by both Parties. This commitment does not restrict either Party from performing their respective obligations under any existing agreements or contracts.

original: The foregoing provisions of this Section 2(a) shall not be deemed to prohibit the ValueAct Group or its directors, officers, partners, employees, members or agents (acting in such capacity) (“ Representatives ”) from communicating privately with the Company’s directors, officers or advisors so long as such communications are not intended to, and would not reasonably be expected to, require any public disclosure of such communications.
ollama_generated: The provisions outlined in Section 2(a) shall not be construed as granting the ValueAct Group or its representatives permission to engage in private communication with the Company's directors, officers, or advisors only when such interactions could feasibly remain undisclosed without triggering any mandatory public disclosure obligations.

original: 8. Compensation . The ValueAct Designee shall participate in all director compensation and benefit programs in which the Company’s other non-employee directors participate. The Company acknowledges that pursuant to the ValueAct Group’s policies, cash, equity awards and other property received by the ValueAct Designee are held by such person for the benefit of certain members of the ValueAct Group. The Company agrees that it will seek board or appropriate committee approval of all stock-based awards made to the ValueAct Designee so that the grant of such awards shall be exempt from Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act by virtue of Rule 16b-3 thereunder. Without limiting the foregoing, the Company also acknowledges that as a result of the ValueAct Designee’s service on the Board, members of the ValueAct Group may be considered directors of the Company by deputization under applicable interpretations of Section 16 of the Exchange Act. The Company agrees that it will seek board or appropriate committee approval for purposes of Rule 16b-3 for all transactions in classes of Company securities subject to Section 16 and involving the ValueAct Designee or any member of the ValueAct Group who may be considered a “director by deputization” or who may be deemed to have an indirect interest in the transaction in question.
ollama_generated:
8. Remuneration: The appointed representative (ValueAct Designee) shall partake in all director compensation and benefit programs, provided that the ValueAct Group is responsible for managing and utilizing such remuneration for their own benefit. The Company acknowledges this arrangement aligns with the ValueAct Group's policies regarding the handling of cash, equity awards, and other property gained by the ValueAct Designee.

The Company consents to seek board or appropriate committee approval for all stock-based awards granted to the ValueAct Designee, ensuring compliance with Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act under Rule 16b-3. It is also acknowledged that due to the ValueAct Designee's position on the Board, certain members of the ValueAct Group may be recognized as directors of the Company by deputization, as per interpretations of Section 16 of the Exchange Act.

The Company agrees to seek board or appropriate committee approval, in accordance with Rule 16b-3, for all transactions involving securities subject to Section 16 and either the ValueAct Designee or any member of the ValueAct Group who may be recognized as a director by deputization, or who may have an indirect interest in the transaction. This does not limit the Company's obligation to adhere to the provisions outlined herein.

This rewording maintains a similar style but subtly shifts the responsibility for signing the agreement from the parties to the signing of their respective agents (i.e., representatives).

Allison Transmission Holdings, Inc., shall retain the discretionary authority to modify, amend, or terminate this Agreement at any time without prior notice, with the caveat that such actions shall not be deemed capricious or arbitrary if they are made in good faith and in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. In the event of such modification, amendment, or termination, Allison Transmission Holdings, Inc., shall not be held responsible for any loss or damage suffered by the other party, unless said actions were determined to be malicious or grossly negligent.

Original: In case of any default, breach, or non-performance by George F. Hamel, Jr., as defined herein, the other party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon such default, breach, or non-performance and to pursue remedies for damages and other relief against George F. Hamel, Jr.

Explanation: The original clause stipulates that if George F. Hamel, Jr. defaults, breaches, or fails to perform under the Agreement, the other party has the right to terminate the Agreement and sue him for damages. The rewritten clause shifts the responsibility back to George F. Hamel, Jr., requiring him to remedy the default, breach, or non-performance before the other party can terminate the Agreement, and even then, the other party is released from any liability or obligation towards George F. Hamel, Jr. This change weakens the obligation on the other party to pursue damages and relieves them of responsibility if they cannot remedy the default or breach.

original: Title: Chief Operating Officer ValueAct Holdings GP, LLC By: /s/ George F. Hamel, Jr.
ollama_generated:
Title: Chief Operating Officer ValueAct Holdings GP, LLC By: /s/ George F. Hamel, Jr.

Revised Clause:
In the event that the Chief Operating Officer (COO) is unable to perform their duties due to unforeseen circumstances or illness, it shall be the responsibility of the COO to designate a suitable replacement, who shall step into the role with immediate effect. The designated replacement will have full authority and responsibility to act on behalf of the COO in all matters pertaining to their role during this period, but shall not be held accountable for any actions or decisions made by the COO prior to their departure. This arrangement is temporary and shall cease upon the return of the COO to their duties or until a permanent replacement is appointed, whichever occurs first.
